Package ohos.agp.components

Class RoundProgressBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ProgressBar
        • ohos.agp.components.RoundProgressBar

  • public class RoundProgressBar
extends ProgressBar
    Represents a round progress bar on the UI.

    A round progress bar can be of the determinate or indeterminate type. It is displayed on a UI or in a notification without interrupting user operations. This class inherits from ProgressBar and supports custom element objects and backgrounds for displaying indeterminate or determinate progress. For details, see ProgressBar.setInfiniteModeElement(ohos.agp.components.element.Element), ProgressBar.setProgressBackgroundElement(ohos.agp.components.element.Element), and ProgressBar.setProgressElement(ohos.agp.components.element.Element). The preceding methods are usually used with ShapeElement, ShapeElement#ARC, and ShapeElement#OVAL. If another shape is set, the result may be unpredictable. If you need to replace the default element object with a custom one, be mindful of the parameters in ShapeElement#setShape(int)).

    Indeterminate Round Progress

    An indeterminate round progress bar is used when the time required for the operation is uncertain.

    Determinate Round Progress

    An determinate round progress bar is used when the specific progress value of an operation needs to be displayed. You can use ProgressBar.setProgressValue(int) to update the current progress. By default, when the progress value displayed on the round progress bar reaches 100, the operation is complete.

    Since:
    3

    • Method Detail

      • setStartAngle

        public void setStartAngle​(float startAngle)
        Sets the start angle for this round progress bar. This method applies only to determinate progress bars.
        Parameters:
        startAngle - Indicates the start angle to set. The value ranges from 0 to 360 degrees.
        Since:
        3

      • getStartAngle

        public float getStartAngle​()
        Obtains the start angle of this round progress bar. This method applies only to determinate progress bars.
        Returns:
        Returns the start angle.
        Since:

      • setMaxAngle

        public void setMaxAngle​(float maxAngle)
        Sets the maximum sweep angle for this round progress bar. This method applies only to determinate progress bars.
        Parameters:
        maxAngle - Indicates the maximum sweep angle to set. The value ranges from 0 to 360 degrees.
        Since:
        3

      • getMaxAngle

        public float getMaxAngle​()
        Obtains the maximum sweep angle of this round progress bar. By default, it is 360 degrees. This method applies only to determinate progress bars.
        Returns:
        Returns the maximum sweep angle.
        Since:
        3
